article:
Coronation of Charles III and Camilla

The coronation of Charles III and Camilla took place on May 6, 2023, at Westminster Abbey in London, United Kingdom. The ceremony marked the formal investiture of Charles III as the King of the United Kingdom and the other Commonwealth realms, following the death of his mother, Elizabeth II, on September 8, 2022. Camilla, Charles's second wife, was also crowned as the Queen Consort.

# Preparation

## Background

The planning for the coronation began shortly after the death of Elizabeth II. The ceremony was organized by the Earl Marshal, the Duke of Norfolk, in conjunction with the British government, the Church of England, and other relevant authorities. The event was designed to be a grand celebration of the monarchy, while also incorporating modern elements and recognizing the diversity of the United Kingdom.

## Service and Procession

The coronation service was conducted by the Archbishop of Canterbury, Justin Welby, and the Archbishop of York, Stephen Cottrell. The ceremony followed a traditional format, with some modifications to reflect the current monarch's preferences. The service included music, prayers, and the traditional elements of the coronation, such as the anointing and crowning of the monarch.

The procession to the abbey was led by the Lord Chancellor, Brandon Lewis, and included members of the royal family, nobles, and other dignitaries. The King and Queen Consort were transported to the abbey in the Gold State Coach, a tradition dating back to the 18th century.

## Guests

The guest list for the coronation included over 2,000 people, representing a wide range of backgrounds and countries. The attendees included members of the royal family, politicians, celebrities, and representatives from the Commonwealth realms. The guest list was carefully curated to reflect the diversity of the United Kingdom and the Commonwealth.

## Vestments and Crowns

The King wore a specially designed set of vestments, including a coronation robe and a pair of gloves. The Queen Consort wore a coronation gown and a crown, designed by the Crown Jeweller. The crowns were set with precious stones, including diamonds, rubies, and sapphires.

## Art

The coronation ceremony featured several works of art, including a new painting by the artist, Yinka Shonibare. The painting, titled "Windrush Generation," depicted the arrival of the Windrush generation in the United Kingdom in 1948. The artwork was displayed in the abbey during the ceremony.

## Music

The coronation ceremony included music performed by the Choir of Westminster Abbey, the London Symphony Orchestra, and other musicians. The music included traditional hymns and anthems, as well as modern compositions.

## Cost

The estimated cost of the coronation was around £100 million, which was covered by the British government and the royal family. The cost included the expenses for the ceremony, the procession, and the security arrangements.

# Coronation Service

## Procession to the Abbey

The procession to the abbey began at 10:30 am, led by the Lord Chancellor and the Earl Marshal. The King and Queen Consort followed in the Gold State Coach, accompanied by the Prince of Wales and the Princess of Wales.

## Procession into the Abbey

The procession into the abbey was led by the Archbishop of Canterbury and the Archbishop of York. The King and Queen Consort were greeted by the clergy and the congregation, who were dressed in their finest attire.

## Recognition

The recognition ceremony took place at the beginning of the service, where the King was recognized as the rightful monarch by the Archbishop of Canterbury.

## Oath and Accession Declaration

The King took the oath and made the accession declaration, promising to uphold the laws and traditions of the United Kingdom.

## Anointing

The anointing ceremony took place, where the King was anointed with holy oil by the Archbishop of Canterbury.

## Investment and Crowning

The King was invested with the symbols of his office, including the coronation ring, the orb, and the sceptre. The Queen Consort was crowned with her coronation crown.

## Enthronement and Homage

The King was enthroned, and the congregation paid homage to him. The Prince of Wales and the Princess of Wales were the first to pay homage, followed by the other members of the royal family and the nobles.

## Coronation of the Queen

The Queen Consort was crowned with her coronation crown, and the congregation paid homage to her.

## Holy Communion

The Holy Communion ceremony took place, where the King and the Queen Consort received the sacrament.

## End of the Service

The service ended with the final blessing, and the congregation was dismissed.

## State Procession to Buckingham Palace

The state procession to Buckingham Palace took place, led by the King and the Queen Consort. The procession included members of the royal family, nobles, and other dignitaries.

## Balcony Appearances

The King and the Queen Consort appeared on the balcony of Buckingham Palace, waving to the crowds.

# Public Events and Commemorations

## United Kingdom

### Ecclesiastical Initiatives

The Church of England organized a series of events and services to commemorate the coronation. The events included a national service of thanksgiving and a procession of clergy.

### Government Initiatives

The British government organized a series of events and initiatives to commemorate the coronation. The events included a state banquet, a reception at Buckingham Palace, and a fireworks display.

### Memorabilia

A range of memorabilia was produced to commemorate the coronation, including coins, stamps, and souvenirs.

### Crown Dependencies

The Crown Dependencies, including Jersey, Guernsey, and the Isle of Man, organized their own events and initiatives to commemorate the coronation.

### British Overseas Territories

The British Overseas Territories, including Gibraltar, Bermuda, and the Falkland Islands, organized their own events and initiatives to commemorate the coronation.

## Canada

### Emblem and Commemorative Items

The Canadian government produced a special emblem and a range of commemorative items to mark the coronation.

### Federal Initiatives

The Canadian government organized a series of events and initiatives to commemorate the coronation, including a state dinner and a reception at Rideau Hall.

### Provincial Initiatives

The provinces and territories of Canada organized their own events and initiatives to commemorate the coronation.

## Australia

The Australian government organized a series of events and initiatives to commemorate the coronation, including a state dinner and a reception at Government House.

## New Zealand

The New Zealand government organized a series of events and initiatives to commemorate the coronation, including a state dinner and a reception at Government House.

## Papua New Guinea

## Solomon Islands

## Vanuatu

The Vanuatu government organized a series of events and initiatives to commemorate the coronation, including a state dinner and a reception at Government House.

# Coverage and Ratings

The coronation ceremony was broadcast live on television and streamed online. The event was covered by major news networks and received high ratings.

# Reactions

## Public Opinion

The public reaction to the coronation was largely positive, with many people expressing their support for the monarchy.

### Post-Coronation

In the days following the coronation, the public continued to show their support for the monarchy, with many people attending events and ceremonies to celebrate the occasion.

## Protests

A small number of protests took place during the coronation, with some groups expressing their opposition to the monarchy.

### Security Arrangements

The security arrangements for the coronation were extensive, with a large police presence and other measures in place to ensure public safety.

### Arrests

A small number of arrests were made during the coronation, including some individuals who attempted to disrupt the ceremony.

## Reparatory Demands

Some groups made reparatory demands during the coronation, calling for compensation for historical injustices.

## Republicanism

Some people expressed republican sentiments during the coronation, calling for the abolition of the monarchy.

## Reaction from International Leaders

International leaders congratulated the King and the Queen Consort on their coronation, and expressed their support for the monarchy.

article:
Jack Mizzi

Jack Mizzi is a Maltese chess player who has made a significant impact on the local chess scene. With a career spanning several decades, Mizzi has established himself as one of the most successful and respected chess players in Malta.

# Chess career

Mizzi's chess career has been marked by numerous achievements and milestones. He has been an active player in the Maltese chess community for many years, participating in various tournaments and competitions.

## Malta records

Mizzi holds several records in Maltese chess. He has been the Maltese chess champion on multiple occasions, and has also represented Malta in several international tournaments. Mizzi's achievements have helped to raise the profile of chess in Malta, inspiring a new generation of players to take up the game.

## COVID pandemic era

The COVID-19 pandemic had a significant impact on the chess world, with many tournaments and competitions being cancelled or postponed. However, Mizzi continued to play and compete, adapting to the new online format that became popular during this time. He participated in several online tournaments, and even won a few, demonstrating his ability to adjust to new circumstances.

## Championships

Mizzi has won numerous championships throughout his career, including multiple Maltese chess championships. He has also competed in several international tournaments, representing Malta and earning recognition for his skills. Some of his notable championship wins include:

* Maltese Chess Championship ( multiple times)
* Malta Open Chess Championship
* Malta Blitz Chess Championship

# Awards and achievements

In addition to his championship wins, Mizzi has received several awards and recognition for his contributions to Maltese chess. Some of his notable awards and achievements include:

* Malta's Chess Player of the Year (multiple times)
* Malta's Sportsman of the Year

The plant's unique characteristics, such as its ability to thrive in poor soil and its adaptation to winter and early spring growth, have allowed it to occupy a specific ecological niche.

Anagyris foetida is commonly known as the stinking bean trefoil, due to its strong, unpleasant smell and its trefoil-shaped leaves. It is also sometimes referred to as the bean trefoil or the Mediterranean trefoil.

Anagyris foetida is native to the Mediterranean region, where it can be found growing in a variety of habitats, including scrublands, woodlands, and along roadsides. It is widely distributed throughout the region, and can be found in countries such as Spain, France, Italy, Greece, and Turkey.

Anagyris foetida is able to thrive in a variety of habitats, including poor soil and dry conditions. It is often found growing in scrublands and woodlands, where it can take advantage of the shade and moisture provided by larger plants. article:
2023 Spanish General Election

The 2023 Spanish general election was held on Sunday, July 23, 2023, to elect the 15th Cortes Generales of the Kingdom of Spain. All 350 seats in the Congress of Deputies and 208 of 266 seats in the Senate were up for election.

# Overview

The election was called by King Felipe VI, following the dissolution of the Cortes Generales on February 29, 2023. The incumbent government, a coalition of the Spanish Socialist Workers' Party (PSOE) and Unidas Podemos, led by Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez, had been in power since January 2020.

## Electoral System

Spain uses a multi-party system with proportional representation. The Congress of Deputies is elected using the D'Hondt method, with each province serving as a constituency. The Senate is elected using a combination of direct and indirect election methods. Each province elects four senators, with the exception of the islands, which elect one or two senators each.

## Election Date

The election date was set for July 23, 2023, by royal decree. The official campaign period began on July 10, 2023, and ended on July 21, 2023.

# Parliamentary Composition

The outgoing Cortes Generales were composed of 350 deputies and 266 senators. The PSOE held 120 seats in the Congress of Deputies, followed by the People's Party (PP) with 88 seats, and Vox with 52 seats.

# Parties and Candidates

Several parties and coalitions contested the election:

* Spanish Socialist Workers' Party (PSOE)
* People's Party (PP)
* Vox
* Unidas Podemos
* Ciudadanos
* More Country
* Junts per Catalunya
* Republican Left of Catalonia

## Timetable

The election timetable was as follows:

* February 29, 2023: Dissolution of the Cortes Generales
* March 31, 2023: Deadline for party registration
* April 28, 2023: Deadline for candidate registration
* May 1, 2023: Official start of the campaign period
* July 10, 2023: Official start of the shortened campaign period
* July 21, 2023: End of the campaign period
* July 23, 2023: Election day

# Campaign

The campaign focused on several key issues, including the economy, healthcare, and Catalonia.

## Issues

The economy was a major issue, with parties debating the best way to stimulate growth and reduce unemployment. The PSOE and Unidas Podemos advocated for increased public spending, while the PP and Ciudadanos argued for tax cuts and deregulation.

Healthcare was another key issue, with parties debating the best way to reform the public healthcare system. The PSOE and Unidas Podemos advocated for increased funding, while the PP and Ciudadanos argued for greater private sector involvement.

Catalonia was also a major issue, with parties debating the best way to address the region's separatist movement. The PSOE and Unidas Podemos advocated for dialogue and greater autonomy, while the PP and Ciudadanos argued for a harder line against separatism.

## Party Slogans

* PSOE: "Unidos podemos"
* PP: "España en serio"
* Vox: "Reconquistar España"
* Unidas Podemos: "La fuerza de la gente"
* Ciudadanos: "La opción sensata"

## Election Debates

Several election debates were held during the campaign period. The most notable debate was the leaders' debate, which took place on July 17, 2023, and featured the leaders of the six main parties.

# Opinion Polls

Several opinion polls were conducted during the campaign period.

## Polling Aggregations

The following polling aggregations were conducted:

* El País: PSOE 27.5%, PP 23.5%, Vox 14.5%, Unidas Podemos 12.5%, Ciudadanos 7.5%
* El Mundo: PSOE 26.5%, PP 24.5%, Vox 15.5%, Unidas Podemos 11.5%, Ciudadanos 7.5%
* La Vanguardia: PSOE 28.5%, PP 22.5%, Vox 13.5%, Unidas Podemos 13.5%, Ciudadanos 6.5%

# Voter Turnout

The voter turnout was 69.9%, with 26,409,037 voters casting ballots.

# Results

## Congress of Deputies

The results of the Congress of Deputies election were as follows:

* PSOE: 122 seats
* PP: 89 seats
* Vox: 58 seats
* Unidas Podemos: 35 seats
* Ciudadanos: 10 seats

## Senate

* PSOE: 113 seats
* PP: 83 seats
* Vox: 30 seats
* Unidas Podemos: 11 seats
* Ciudadanos: 5 seats
* More Country: 2 seats

* Republican Left of Catalonia: 2 seats

## Elected Members

The following members were elected:

* PSOE: Pedro Sánchez, Carmen Calvo, María Jesús Montero
* PP: Pablo Casado, Teodoro García Egea, Cuca Gamarra
* Vox: Santiago Abascal, Javier Ortega Smith, Iván Espinosa de los Monteros
* Unidas Podemos: Pablo Iglesias, Irene Montero, Alberto Garzón
* Ciudadanos: Inés Arrimadas, José Manuel Villegas, Marta Rivera de la Cruz

# Aftermath

## Government Formation

The election resulted in a hung parliament, with no party holding a majority. The PSOE and Unidas Podemos formed a coalition government, with Pedro Sánchez as prime minister.

OceanGate
================

OceanGate is a United States-based company that specializes in manned submersible services for research, exploration, and adventure travel. Founded in 2009, the company has made significant contributions to the field of underwater exploration, including dives to the Titanic wreck site and the development of advanced submersible vessels.

Background
----------

OceanGate was founded with the goal of making underwater exploration more accessible and affordable for researchers, scientists, and adventurers. The company's founders, including Stockton Rush, recognized the potential for submersibles to revolutionize our understanding of the ocean and its ecosystems. With a focus on safety, innovation, and customer experience, OceanGate set out to create a new standard for manned submersible operations.

History
-------

### 2009–2013: Founding and acquisition of Antipodes

OceanGate was founded in 2009 by Stockton Rush and Guillermo Söhnlein. The company's early years were marked by the acquisition of the Antipodes submersible, a deep-diving vessel designed for research and exploration. The Antipodes was used for a variety of projects, including underwater archaeology and marine biology research. During this period, OceanGate established itself as a leading provider of manned submersible services, with a focus on safety, reliability, and customer satisfaction.

### 2013–2016: Construction of Cyclops and Söhnlein's departure

In 2013, OceanGate began construction on a new submersible vessel, the Cyclops 1. Designed to be a more advanced and capable platform than the Antipodes, the Cyclops 1 featured a larger payload capacity and improved life support systems. However, the project was not without its challenges, and the vessel experienced several delays and setbacks during its development. In 2014, co-founder Guillermo Söhnlein left the company, citing creative differences and a desire to pursue other ventures.

### 2016–2023: Expansion of fleet and dives to the Titanic

Despite the challenges faced during the development of the Cyclops 1, OceanGate continued to expand its fleet and operations. In 2016, the company launched the Titan submersible, a deep-diving vessel designed specifically for research and exploration. The Titan quickly gained a reputation as one of the most advanced submersibles in the world, with a range of over 12,000 feet and a payload capacity of over 3,000 pounds. In 2019, OceanGate made headlines with a series of dives to the Titanic wreck site, using the Titan submersible to capture stunning footage and conduct research on the historic site.

### 2023: Implosion of Titan and death of Rush

Tragedy struck in 2023, when the Titan submersible imploded during a dive to the Titanic wreck site. The incident resulted in the loss of the vessel and the death of Stockton Rush, OceanGate's founder and CEO. The cause of the implosion is still under investigation, but it is believed to have been the result of a combination of technical and human factors.

article:
Elon Musk

Elon Musk is a South African-born entrepreneur, inventor, and business magnate. He is best known for his ambitious goals in revolutionizing transportation, energy, and space exploration. Through his innovative ventures, Musk has become one of the most successful and influential figures in the tech industry.

# Early life and education

## Childhood and family

Elon Reeve Musk was born on June 28, 1971, in Pretoria, South Africa. His father, Errol Musk, was an engineer, and his mother, Maye Musk, was a model and dietitian. Musk's parents divorced when he was ten years old, and he was raised by his father in Pretoria. He has two younger siblings, Kimbal and Tosca.

Musk developed an interest in computing and programming at an early age. He taught himself computer programming and, at the age of 12, created his first software program, a space-themed video game called Blastar.

## Education

Musk attended Pretoria University High School and was an introverted child who was often bullied by his peers. He found solace in reading and learning, devouring books on a wide range of subjects, including physics, mathematics, and philosophy.

After completing high school, Musk moved to Canada to attend college, hoping to avoid the mandatory military service in South Africa. He enrolled at Queen's University in Kingston, Ontario, but transferred to the University of Pennsylvania two years later. Musk graduated with a degree in economics and physics from the University of Pennsylvania in 1997.

# Business career

## Zip2

Musk's first venture was Zip2, a company he co-founded in 1995 with his brother Kimbal. Zip2 provided online content publishing software for news organizations, and Musk served as the company's CEO. In 1999, Compaq acquired Zip2 for $307 million, with Musk receiving $22 million for his 7% stake in the company.

## X.com and PayPal

In 1999, Musk co-founded X.com, which later became PayPal, an online payment system that was acquired by eBay for $1.5 billion in 2002. Musk was the company's largest shareholder, and he made a significant amount of money from the sale.

## SpaceX

Musk founded SpaceX in 2002 with the ambitious goal of reducing space transportation costs and enabling the colonization of Mars. SpaceX has since become a leading player in the private space industry, with numerous successful launches and a contract with NASA to transport astronauts to the International Space Station.

### Starlink

In 2019, SpaceX launched its Starlink satellite constellation, a network of low-Earth orbit satellites designed to provide global internet connectivity. The project aims to generate revenue for SpaceX and help fund its Mars ambitions.

## Tesla

In 2004, Musk co-founded Tesla, Inc., which has become one of the leading electric vehicle manufacturers in the world. The company has disrupted the automotive industry and played a significant role in popularizing electric vehicles.

### SEC and shareholder lawsuits regarding tweets

In 2018, Musk faced criticism for his tweets about Tesla's financial performance and his plans to take the company private. The Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) charged Musk with securities fraud, and he agreed to pay a $20 million fine and step down as Tesla's chairman.

### SolarCity and Tesla Energy

In 2016, Tesla acquired SolarCity, a solar energy company co-founded by Musk. The acquisition expanded Tesla's clean energy offerings and helped the company become a leader in the solar energy market.

## Neuralink

In 2016, Musk co-founded Neuralink, a neurotechnology company that aims to integrate the human brain with computers. The company is developing implantable brain–machine interfaces (BMIs) that could potentially treat a wide range of medical conditions.

## The Boring Company

In 2016, Musk co-founded The Boring Company, a tunnel construction company that aims to reduce traffic congestion in cities by building underground tunnels for high-speed transportation.

## Twitter / X

In 2022, Musk acquired Twitter, Inc. and rebranded it as X. Musk has stated that he plans to use the platform to promote free speech and reduce content moderation.

## Leadership style

Musk is known for his demanding leadership style, which emphasizes innovation, risk-taking, and rapid iteration. He has been praised for his ability to inspire and motivate his employees, but has also faced criticism for his management style, which some have described as autocratic and intense.

# Other activities

## Musk Foundation

The Musk Foundation, established in 2002, focuses on providing solar-power energy systems in disaster areas and supporting STEM education.

## Hyperloop

In 2013, Musk proposed the Hyperloop, a high-speed transportation system that could travel at speeds of up to 700 mph (1,127 km/h). The project aims to reduce travel times between cities and has the potential to transform the transportation industry.

## OpenAI and xAI

In 2015, Musk co-founded OpenAI, a non-profit research organization that aims to develop and promote friendly artificial intelligence. In 2019, Musk left the OpenAI board to avoid conflicts with his work at Neuralink.

## Tham Luang cave rescue and defamation case

In 2018, Musk was involved in a highly publicized cave rescue in Thailand, where a group of boys became trapped. Musk's attempt to assist the rescue effort was met with criticism, and he faced a defamation lawsuit from one of the rescue divers.

## 2018 cannabis incident

In 2018, Musk sparked controversy when he smoked cannabis during a live podcast interview. The incident raised concerns about Musk's behavior and judgment.

## Music

Musk has released several electronic music tracks, including "Don't Doubt Ur Vibe" and "Test Track".

## Private jet

Musk has faced criticism for his use of a private jet, which has been seen as contradictory to his environmental goals.

## Company towns

In 2022, Musk announced plans to build a company town near SpaceX's Starbase facility in Texas. The town, called Starbase, will provide housing and amenities for SpaceX employees.

# Wealth

Musk's net worth has fluctuated over the years, but he is currently one of the richest people in the world, with an estimated net worth of over $200 billion.

# Personal actions, views, and social media usage

## Finance

Musk has been a vocal critic of the current financial system and has advocated for a more decentralized and transparent approach to finance.

## Technology

Musk has expressed concerns about the risks of advanced technologies, including artificial intelligence and biotechnology.

## Existential threats

Musk has spoken about the need to address existential threats, such as climate change and nuclear war, and has advocated for a more proactive approach to mitigating these risks.

## Politics

Musk has been involved in several high-profile controversies related to politics, including his support for conservative politicians and his criticism of liberal policies.

### Conservative PAC activities

In 2022, Musk was revealed to have donated to a conservative political action committee (PAC), sparking criticism from some of his fans.

### International politics

Musk has expressed support for several international leaders, including Vladimir Putin and Xi Jinping, and has faced criticism for his views on geopolitics.

## Accusations of antisemitism

Musk has faced accusations of antisemitism due to his criticism of Jewish finance and his perceived support for anti-Semitic ideologies.

## COVID-19

Musk has been a vocal critic of COVID-19 lockdowns and has advocated for a more nuanced approach to managing the pandemic.

# Personal life

## Relationships and children

Musk has been married three times and has seven children. He has been in a relationship with Canadian musician Grimes since 2018.

## Legal matters after 2020

Musk has faced several legal challenges in recent years, including a lawsuit from Twitter over his acquisition of the company.

# Public perception

Musk's public perception has been complex and multifaceted, with some people viewing him as a visionary and others seeing him as a self-promoter.

article:
2022 FIVB Women's Volleyball World Championship

The 2022 FIVB Women's Volleyball World Championship is the 19th edition of the FIVB Volleyball Women's World Championship, the world championship for women's national volleyball teams organized by Fédération Internationale de Volleyball (FIVB). The tournament will be held in the Netherlands and Poland from September 23 to October 15, 2022.

# Host selection

The FIVB announced the hosts for the 2022 Women's World Championship on January 12, 2019. The Netherlands and Poland were chosen as co-hosts, marking the first time the tournament will be held in two countries.

# Qualification

A total of 24 teams will participate in the tournament. The qualification process began in 2021 and ended in August 2022. The top two teams from each of the four FIVB confederations (Africa, Asia, Europe, and South America) qualified directly to the tournament, while the remaining teams were determined through continental qualification tournaments.

# Squads

Each of the 24 participating teams will consist of 14 players, with a maximum of 12 players per team eligible to play in each match.

# Venues

The tournament will be held in six cities across the Netherlands and Poland. The Dutch cities are Rotterdam, Amsterdam, and Apeldoorn, while the Polish cities are Gdańsk, Łódź, and Arnhem.

# Format

The tournament will consist of three rounds: the first round, second round, and final round.

## First round

The 24 teams will be divided into four pools of six teams each. Each team will play the other teams in their pool once, with the top four teams from each pool advancing to the second round.

## Second round

The 16 teams that advanced from the first round will be divided into two pools of eight teams each. Each team will play the other teams in their pool once, with the top three teams from each pool advancing to the final round.

## Final round

The final round will consist of a quarterfinal round, semifinal round, and final round. The quarterfinals will feature the top three teams from each pool, with the winners advancing to the semifinals. The semifinals will feature the winners of the quarterfinals, with the winners advancing to the final. The losers of the semifinals will play in the 3rd place match.

# Pools composition

## First round

Pool A: Netherlands, Italy, Belgium, Puerto Rico, Kenya, Cameroon
Pool B: Poland, Turkey, Dominican Republic, South Korea, Thailand, Croatia
Pool C: United States, China, Russia, Brazil, Japan, Argentina
Pool D: Serbia, Canada, Germany, Bulgaria, Mexico, Kazakhstan

## Second round

Pool E: Top 4 teams from Pool A and Pool B
Pool F: Top 4 teams from Pool C and Pool D

# Pool standing procedure

In case of a tie in the pool standings, the following criteria will be used to determine the ranking:

1. Number of matches won
2. Points ratio
3. Sets ratio
4. Points scored

# First round

## Pool A

The Netherlands will host Pool A matches in Rotterdam and Amsterdam.

## Pool B

Poland will host Pool B matches in Gdańsk and Łódź.

## Pool C

The United States will host Pool C matches in Apeldoorn and Arnhem.

## Pool D

Serbia will host Pool D matches in Łódź and Gdańsk.

# Second round

## Pool E

The top 4 teams from Pool A and Pool B will compete in Pool E, with matches held in Rotterdam and Amsterdam.

## Pool F

The top 4 teams from Pool C and Pool D will compete in Pool F, with matches held in Gdańsk and Łódź.

# Final round

## Quarterfinals

The quarterfinals will feature the top 3 teams from Pool E and Pool F, with matches held in Rotterdam and Gdańsk.

## Semifinals

The semifinals will feature the winners of the quarterfinals, with matches held in Rotterdam and Gdańsk.

## 3rd place match

The losers of the semifinals will play in the 3rd place match, with the match held in Rotterdam.

## Final

The final match will feature the winners of the semifinals, with the match held in Rotterdam.

# Final standing

The final standing will be determined by the results of the final round.

# Awards

The tournament will feature several awards, including the Most Valuable Player, Best Setter, Best Outside Hitters, Best Middle Blockers, Best Libero, and Best Opposite.

# Statistics leaders

The tournament will feature several statistical categories, including scoring, blocking, serving, and digging.

* Volleyball at the Summer Olympics
* FIVB Volleyball World Grand Prix

# Notes

* This article is a general overview of the 2022 FIVB Women's Volleyball World Championship. For more detailed information, please consult the official FIVB website.

# References

article:
Big Brother Brasil 23
=====================

Big Brother Brasil 23, also known as BBB23, was the twenty-third season of the Brazilian reality television series Big Brother Brasil, which premiered on January 16, 2023. The season was broadcast on Rede Globo and hosted by Tadeu Schneider and Ticiane Pinheiro.

The Game
--------

### Final Prize Change Throughout the Season

The final prize for Big Brother Brasil 23 was R$1.5 million, which was the same as the previous season. However, the prize money was not the only incentive for the housemates, as they also competed for other prizes and advantages throughout the season.

### Super HoH

The Super HoH (Head of Household) was a twist introduced in this season, where the HoH would have the power to nominate not one, but two housemates for eviction. This twist was used in several episodes, adding an extra layer of strategy and tension to the game.

### Withdrawal Button

The Withdrawal Button was a new feature introduced in BBB23, which allowed housemates to voluntarily leave the game. When a housemate pressed the button, they would immediately be eliminated from the competition and leave the Big Brother house. This feature was used by several housemates throughout the season.

#### FeedBBB

FeedBBB was a social media platform created by Big Brother Brasil, where housemates could share their thoughts and feelings about the game. The platform was used by the housemates to express their opinions and interact with each other outside of the main game.

### Selective Collection

Selective Collection was a game mechanic where housemates would have to collect a certain item or complete a task to earn rewards or advantages. This feature was used in several episodes, adding an extra layer of challenge and competition to the game.

### Evicted's Message

When a housemate was evicted, they would leave a message for the remaining housemates, which would be revealed after their departure. This feature allowed the evicted housemate to have a final say in the game and provide some closure for the remaining housemates.

### Glass House

The Glass House was a twist where a housemate would be isolated from the rest of the housemates and have limited contact with them. This feature was used in several episodes, adding an extra layer of challenge and isolation to the game.

### Duos Twist

The Duos Twist was a feature where two housemates would be paired together and have to work as a team to complete tasks and challenges. This feature was used in several episodes, adding an extra layer of teamwork and strategy to the game.

### Secret Room

The Secret Room was a feature where a housemate would be given access to a secret room, where they would have to complete a task or make a decision that would affect the game. This feature was used in several episodes, adding an extra layer of mystery and intrigue to the game.

### Higher Power

The Higher Power was a feature where a housemate would be given a special power that would allow them to influence the game. This feature was used in several episodes, adding an extra layer of strategy and power to the game.

### White Room

The White Room was a feature where a housemate would be given access to a special room, where they would have to make a decision that would affect the game. This feature was used in several episodes, adding an extra layer of challenge and strategy to the game.

### Housemate Exchange

The Housemate Exchange was a feature where two housemates would be swapped with housemates from another Big Brother season. This feature was used in one episode, adding an extra layer of surprise and challenge to the game.

### Repechage Twist

The Repechage Twist was a feature where an evicted housemate would have the opportunity to return to the game. This feature was used in one episode, adding an extra layer of surprise and challenge to the game.

### Vote to Save

The Vote to Save was a feature where the public would vote to save a housemate from eviction. This feature was used in several episodes, adding an extra layer of public involvement and suspense to the game.

### Power of Veto

The Power of Veto was a feature where a housemate would have the power to veto a nomination. This feature was used in several episodes, adding an extra layer of strategy and power to the game.

### Joker Power

The Joker Power was a feature where a housemate would have the power to change the course of the game. This feature was used in several episodes, adding an extra layer of surprise and challenge to the game.

### Power of No

The Power of No was a feature where a housemate would have the power to say no to a task or challenge. This feature was used in several episodes, adding an extra layer of challenge and strategy to the game.

### Big Phone

The Big Phone was a feature where a housemate would receive a call from an unknown person, who would give them a task or challenge. This feature was used in several episodes, adding an extra layer of surprise and challenge to the game.

### The Counterattack

The Counterattack was a feature where a housemate would have the opportunity to counterattack and change the course of the game. This feature was used in several episodes, adding an extra layer of strategy and power to the game.

Housemates
----------

This season featured 20 housemates, who were divided into two groups: the "Rich" and the "Poor". The Rich group had access to better living conditions and more luxuries, while the Poor group had to live in more basic conditions.

Future Appearances
-----------------

Several housemates from Big Brother Brasil 23 have gone on to appear in other TV shows and media, including reality TV shows, soap operas, and talk shows.

Voting History
--------------

The voting history for Big Brother Brasil 23 was as follows:

### Notes

* The housemate with the most votes each week was nominated for eviction.
* The public voted to save a housemate from eviction each week.
* The housemates voted among themselves to determine the winner of the season.

### Have and Have-Nots

The Have and Have-Nots competition was a weekly challenge where the housemates would compete to determine which group would have access to better living conditions and more luxuries. The winning group would be the "Haves", while the losing group would be the "Have-Nots".

Ratings and Reception
---------------------

### Brazilian Ratings

Big Brother Brasil 23 was a ratings success, with an average audience of 22 million viewers per episode. The season finale was watched by 35 million viewers, making it one of the most-watched TV shows in Brazil in 2023.

----------

article:
Russian Invasion of Ukraine

The Russian invasion of Ukraine is an ongoing military conflict that began on February 24, 2022. The invasion marked a significant escalation of the Russo-Ukrainian War, which had been ongoing since 2014. The conflict has resulted in significant loss of life, displacement of people, and economic devastation in Ukraine, as well as international condemnation and sanctions against Russia.

# Background

## Post-Soviet relations

Following the dissolution of the Soviet Union in 1991, Ukraine and Russia established diplomatic relations. However, the two countries had a complex and often tense relationship, with disputes over issues such as energy, trade, and security. In 2004, Ukraine's Orange Revolution led to a shift towards closer ties with the European Union and NATO, which was met with opposition from Russia.

## Ukrainian revolution, Russian intervention in Crimea and Donbas

In 2014, Ukraine's Euromaidan protests led to the ousting of President Viktor Yanukovych, who was seen as pro-Russian. Russia responded by annexing Crimea and supporting separatist rebels in the Donbas region of eastern Ukraine. The conflict in Donbas resulted in the deaths of over 14,000 people and the displacement of millions.

# Prelude

## Putin's invasion announcement

On February 21, 2022, Russian President Vladimir Putin announced that he would recognize the independence of the Donetsk and Luhansk People's Republics, two breakaway regions in eastern Ukraine. This move was seen as a precursor to a full-scale invasion of Ukraine.

# Events

## Initial invasion (24 February – 7 April)

### Kyiv and northern front

On February 24, 2022, Russian forces launched a surprise attack on Ukraine, with missile strikes and artillery bombardments hitting major cities, including Kyiv. The Ukrainian military responded with resistance, but Russian forces were able to make significant gains, capturing the Chernobyl nuclear power plant and the city of Kherson.

### Northeastern front

Russian forces also launched a separate attack on Ukraine's northeastern border, with the aim of capturing the city of Kharkiv. However, Ukrainian forces were able to hold off the attack, and the city remained under Ukrainian control.

### Southern front

Russian forces also made gains in southern Ukraine, capturing the city of Melitopol and the Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant.

### Eastern front

In eastern Ukraine, Russian-backed separatist forces launched an attack on Ukrainian positions, but were met with resistance.

## Southeastern front (8 April – 5 September)

### Fall of Mariupol

After a prolonged siege, the city of Mariupol fell to Russian forces on May 20, 2022. The city's capture was seen as a significant strategic gain for Russia, as it provided access to the Sea of Azov.

### Fall of Sievierodonetsk and Lysychansk

In June 2022, Russian forces captured the cities of Sievierodonetsk and Lysychansk, which were seen as key strongholds for Ukrainian forces in the Donbas region.

### Kharkiv front

In May 2022, Ukrainian forces launched a counterattack against Russian positions in the Kharkiv region, recapturing several villages and towns.

### Kherson-Mykolaiv front

In June 2022, Ukrainian forces launched a counterattack against Russian positions in the Kherson region, recapturing several villages and towns.

### Zaporizhzhia front

In July 2022, Ukrainian forces launched a counterattack against Russian positions in the Zaporizhzhia region, recapturing several villages and towns.

## Russian annexations and occupation losses (6 September – 11 November 2022)

### Russian annexation of Donetsk, Kherson, Luhansk and Zaporizhzhia oblasts

On September 30, 2022, Russia annexed the Donetsk, Kherson, Luhansk and Zaporizhzhia oblasts, which were seen as a significant escalation of the conflict.

### Zaporizhzhia front

In October 2022, Ukrainian forces launched a counterattack against Russian positions in the Zaporizhzhia region, recapturing several villages and towns.

### Kherson counteroffensive

In October 2022, Ukrainian forces launched a counterattack against Russian positions in the Kherson region, recapturing the city of Kherson.

### Kharkiv counteroffensive

In October 2022, Ukrainian forces launched a counterattack against Russian positions in the Kharkiv region, recapturing several villages and towns.

## Winter stalemate, attrition campaign and military surge (12 November 2022 – 7 June 2023)

### Battle of Bakhmut

In December 2022, Russian forces launched an attack on the city of Bakhmut, which was seen as a key strategic location in the Donbas region. The battle was ongoing as of June 2023.

## 2023 counteroffensives and summer campaign (8 June 2023 – 1 December 2023)

In June 2023, Ukrainian forces launched a counterattack against Russian positions in the Donbas region, recapturing several villages and towns.

## Russian spring and summer campaigns and Ukrainian incursion (1 December 2023 – present)

### Russian offensive

In December 2023, Russian forces launched a new offensive against Ukrainian positions in the Donbas region.

### Ukrainian offensive and further Donbas advances

In December 2023, Ukrainian forces launched a counterattack against Russian positions in the Donbas region, recapturing several villages and towns.

# Battlespaces

## Command

The conflict has seen significant changes in command, with Ukraine's military leadership undergoing several changes.

## Missile attacks and aerial warfare

### Crimea attacks

In August 2022, Ukraine launched a series of missile attacks against Russian naval bases in Crimea.

### Russian attacks against Ukrainian civilian infrastructure

Throughout the conflict, Russia has launched numerous attacks against Ukrainian civilian infrastructure, including power plants, hospitals, and schools.

## Naval blockade and engagements

The conflict has seen a significant naval blockade, with Russia blockading Ukrainian ports and preventing the export of grain.

## Nuclear risk

The conflict has raised concerns about the risk of nuclear war, with both sides possessing nuclear capabilities.

## Ukrainian resistance

The conflict has seen significant resistance from Ukrainian civilians, with many taking up arms to fight against Russian forces.

# International aspects

## Reactions

The conflict has been widely condemned by the international community, with many countries imposing sanctions on Russia.

## Foreign involvement

### Support for Ukraine

Several countries have provided military and economic support to Ukraine, including the United States, the United Kingdom, and Canada.

### Support for Russia

Several countries have provided support to Russia, including Belarus, China, and Iran.

# Casualties

The conflict has resulted in significant loss of life, with estimates suggesting that over 100,000 people have been killed.

# Prisoners of war

The conflict has seen a significant number of prisoners of war, with both sides holding hundreds of captives.

# War crimes and attacks on civilians

## Abduction of Ukrainian children

There have been reports of Russian forces abducting Ukrainian children, with many being taken to Russia.

## International arrest warrants

Several international arrest warrants have been issued for Russian officials, including President Vladimir Putin.

# Impacts

## Humanitarian impact

The conflict has had a significant humanitarian impact, with millions of people displaced and in need of aid.

## Refugee crisis

The conflict has resulted in a significant refugee crisis, with millions of people fleeing Ukraine.

## Long-term demographic effects

The conflict is likely to have significant long-term demographic effects, with many Ukrainians having fled the country.

## Environmental impact

The conflict has had a significant environmental impact, with many areas contaminated with unexploded ordnance and toxic chemicals.

## Economic impact

### Ukraine

The conflict has had a significant economic impact on Ukraine, with the country's economy expected to contract by over 30%.

### Russia

The conflict has also had a significant economic impact on Russia, with the country's economy expected to contract by over 10%.

# Peace efforts

Several peace efforts have been launched, including a series of talks between Ukraine and Russia.

# See also

* Russo-Ukrainian War
* War in Donbas
* Annexation of Crimea by the Russian Federation
* 2022 Russian invasion of Ukraine

# Notes

* This article is based on information available up to December 2023.

2023–24 Indian Super League

The 2023–24 Indian Super League season, also known as Hero Indian Super League for sponsorship reasons, is the 11th season of the Indian Super League, the top professional football league in India. The season kicked off on 23 September 2023 and is scheduled to conclude on 25 March 2024.

# Changes from last season

The 2023–24 season sees several changes from the previous season. The biggest change is the introduction of a new playoff format, where the top six teams will qualify for the playoffs, instead of the top four teams in the previous season. The playoffs will consist of a knockout round, semi-finals, and a final. Additionally, the league has introduced a new charity match, which will be played between the winner of the league and a team representing the Indian national team.

The 2022–23 Premier League is the 31st season of the Premier League, the top English professional league for association football clubs, since its establishment in 1992. The season started on 6 August 2022 and is scheduled to conclude on 28 May 2023.

The 2022–23 Premier League season is the first to feature a mid-season break, which took place from 14 November to 26 December 2022, due to the 2022 FIFA World Cup in Qatar. India at the 2022 Commonwealth Games

The 2022 Commonwealth Games, officially known as the XXII Commonwealth Games, were held in Birmingham, England from 28 July to 8 August 2022. India was one of the 72 participating nations at the multi-sport event. The Indian contingent consisted of 213 athletes competing in 19 sports.

# Withdrawal threat

In July 2022, the Indian Olympic Association (IOA) threatened to withdraw the Indian contingent from the 2022 Commonwealth Games due to the exclusion of shooting, wrestling, and archery from the Games' program. However, after a meeting with the Commonwealth Games Federation (CGF), the IOA decided to participate in the Games.

# Competitors

article:
Instasamka
================

Instasamka is a Russian rapper, singer, and songwriter. She gained widespread recognition in the Russian music industry with her unique style and provocative lyrics. Instasamka's music often explores themes of love, relationships, and female empowerment, resonating with a younger generation of listeners.

Early Life
-----------

Instasamka was born on February 1, 1998, in Moscow, Russia. Her real name is Darya Zoteeva. Growing up in a musical family, she was exposed to various genres of music from an early age. Instasamka's parents encouraged her to pursue her passion for music, and she began writing her own songs and poetry as a teenager.

Instasamka's early life was marked by a strong interest in hip-hop culture. She was influenced by American rappers such as Kendrick Lamar and Nicki Minaj, as well as Russian artists like Noize MC and L'One. She began performing at local music events and open mic nights, honing her skills and developing her unique style.

Career
--------

Instasamka's music career began to gain momentum in 2017, when she released her debut single "Moy Raje" (My Paradise). The song's success led to her signing with the Russian record label, Rhymes Music. In 2018, she released her debut studio album, "Tri Zhelaniya" (Three Wishes), which received positive reviews from critics and fans alike.

Instasamka's subsequent releases, including the albums "Nevidimka" (Invisible) and "Moy Raje 2", solidified her position as a prominent figure in the Russian music industry. Her music often incorporates elements of trap, drill, and pop, showcasing her versatility as an artist.

In addition to her solo work, Instasamka has collaborated with other notable Russian artists, such as Timati and Grigoriy Leps. She has also performed at various music festivals, including the Afisha Picnic and VK Fest.

Personal Life
-------------

Instasamka is known for her outspoken personality and unapologetic lyrics, which often address themes of love, relationships, and female empowerment. She has been open about her experiences with online harassment and sexism, using her platform to raise awareness about these issues.

In 2020, Instasamka sparked controversy with her song "Rossiya, Ya Lublyu Tebya" (Russia, I Love You), which some critics interpreted as a patriotic anthem. Instasamka later clarified that the song was intended to be a commentary on the complexities of Russian identity and culture.

* "Tri Zhelaniya" (Three Wishes) (2018)
* "Nevidimka" (Invisible) (2019)
* "Moy Raje 2" (2020)
* "Putana" (2022)

### Remix Albums

* "Tri Zhelaniya: Remixes" (2019)

Preferences
------------

Instasamka's music often incorporates elements of hip-hop, trap, and pop. She has cited artists such as Kendrick Lamar, Nicki Minaj, and L'One as influences on her style. Instasamka is known for her provocative lyrics and unapologetic approach to songwriting, which often addresses themes of love, relationships, and female empowerment.

2022 in British Television

The year 2022 in British television saw a wide range of new and returning programmes, as well as changes to the broadcasting landscape.

# Events

## January

The 2022 Welsh Open was a professional snooker tournament held from 28 February to 6 March 2022 at the Venue Cymru in Llandudno, Wales. It was the 31st edition of the Welsh Open, a ranking tournament that is part of the Home Nations series, and the 12th ranking event of the 2021-22 snooker season.

#Format

The tournament featured 128 players competing in a knockout format, with all matches played over the best-of-seven frames until the semi-finals, which were best-of-nine frames. The final was played over the best-of-17 frames.

Background and overview

Rihanna was officially announced as the halftime show headliner on September 25, 2022, by the National Football League (NFL) and Roc Nation, a entertainment company founded by Jay-Z. The halftime show was produced by Roc Nation and Jesse Collins Entertainment, with Adam Blackstone serving as the musical director. The event featured a medley of Rihanna's hit songs, as well as several special guests and a large ensemble of dancers and musicians.

article:
The Fabelmans
===============

The Fabelmans is a 2022 American coming-of-age drama film written and directed by Steven Spielberg. The film is a semi-autobiographical account of Spielberg's own childhood and teenage years, exploring his early passion for filmmaking and the complexities of his family life. The Fabelmans premiered at the Toronto International Film Festival in September 2022 and received widespread critical acclaim for its nostalgic portrayal of the 1950s and 1960s, as well as its thoughtful exploration of the challenges faced by young artists.

Plot
-----

The Fabelmans tells the story of Sammy Fabelman, a young boy growing up in Arizona in the 1950s and 1960s. Sammy is a curious and imaginative child who becomes fascinated with filmmaking after watching a train crash scene in Cecil B. DeMille's "The Greatest Show on Earth." With the encouragement of his parents, Mitzi and Burt, Sammy begins making his own short films using his father's 8mm camera.

As Sammy grows older, he becomes increasingly obsessed with filmmaking, using his camera to capture the world around him and to tell stories that reflect his own experiences and emotions. However, his passion for filmmaking is not without its challenges. Sammy's father, a computer engineer, is often at odds with his son's creative pursuits, viewing them as a distraction from more practical and secure career paths.

Meanwhile, Sammy's mother, a former concert pianist, struggles to balance her own creative ambitions with the demands of raising a family. As the Fabelman family navigates the complexities of post-war American life, Sammy must confront the tensions between his own artistic aspirations and the expectations of those around him.

Cast
-----

* Gabriel LaBelle as Sammy Fabelman
* Michelle Williams as Mitzi Fabelman
* Paul Dano as Burt Fabelman
* Seth Rogen as Bennie Loewy
* Julia Butters as Reggie Fabelman
* Keeley Karsten as Natalie Fabelman
* Jeannie Berlin as Haddie Fabelman
* Judd Hirsch as Uncle Boris

Production
------------

### Development

The Fabelmans was first announced in March 2021, with Spielberg set to write and direct the film. The project was developed in collaboration with Amblin Entertainment and Universal Pictures, with Kristie Macosko Krieger and Tony Kushner serving as producers.

### Writing

Spielberg began writing the screenplay for The Fabelmans in 2020, drawing heavily from his own childhood experiences and memories. The film's script was influenced by Spielberg's early love of filmmaking, as well as his relationships with his parents and siblings.

### Pre-production

Pre-production on The Fabelmans began in the spring of 2021, with casting and location scouting underway. The film's production team worked closely with Spielberg to recreate the look and feel of 1950s and 1960s America, using a combination of practical sets and location shooting.

### Casting

Casting for The Fabelmans was a key part of the film's pre-production process. Gabriel LaBelle was cast as Sammy Fabelman, with Michelle Williams and Paul Dano playing his parents. Seth Rogen, Julia Butters, and Keeley Karsten rounded out the cast as members of the Fabelman family and their friends.

### Filming

Principal photography on The Fabelmans began in July 2021, with filming taking place in various locations across the United States. The film's production team used a combination of digital and film cameras to capture the look and feel of classic Hollywood movies.

### Production design

The production design for The Fabelmans was led by Rick Carter, who worked closely with Spielberg to recreate the look and feel of 1950s and 1960s America. The film's sets and costumes were designed to evoke the nostalgia and optimism of post-war America, while also capturing the complexities and challenges faced by the Fabelman family.

### Visual effects

The visual effects for The Fabelmans were created by Industrial Light & Magic, with a team of artists and technicians working to enhance the film's practical effects and recreate the look of classic Hollywood movies.

Music
------

The score for The Fabelmans was composed by John Williams, who has collaborated with Spielberg on numerous films throughout his career. The film's soundtrack features a combination of original themes and classic Hollywood scores, evoking the nostalgia and wonder of the movies.

Themes and interpretations
---------------------------

The Fabelmans explores a number of themes and ideas, including the power of creativity and imagination, the challenges faced by young artists, and the complexities of family relationships. The film is also a nostalgic tribute to the movies of the 1950s and 1960s, capturing the look and feel of classic Hollywood films.

Release
---------

### Theatrical

The Fabelmans premiered at the Toronto International Film Festival in September 2022, with a limited release in the United States and Canada. The film received widespread critical acclaim and was subsequently released in theaters around the world.

### Home media

The Fabelmans was released on home media in December 2022, with a Blu-ray and DVD edition featuring behind-the-scenes footage and deleted scenes.

### Marketing

The marketing campaign for The Fabelmans was led by Universal Pictures, with a focus on promoting the film's nostalgic value and Spielberg's personal connection to the story. The film's trailer and promotional materials featured a combination of classic Hollywood imagery and behind-the-scenes footage, highlighting the film's attention to detail and period authenticity.

Reception
------------

### Box office

The Fabelmans was a commercial success, grossing over $100 million at the box office worldwide. The film's success was driven by positive word-of-mouth and critical acclaim, with audiences responding to the film's nostalgic value and Spielberg's personal connection to the story.

### Critical response

The Fabelmans received widespread critical acclaim, with praise for its nostalgic portrayal of 1950s and 1960s America, as well as its thoughtful exploration of the challenges faced by young artists. The film holds a 95% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, with many critics praising Spielberg's direction and the performances of the cast.

### Legacy

The Fabelmans is likely to be remembered as one of Spielberg's most personal and nostalgic films, capturing the look and feel of classic Hollywood movies while also exploring the complexities of family relationships and the challenges faced by young artists.

### Accolades

The Fabelmans received numerous awards and nominations, including several Academy Award nominations and a Golden Globe nomination for Best Motion Picture - Drama.

Possible sequel

There has been no official announcement of a sequel to The Fabelmans, although the film's ending leaves room for further exploration of the Fabelman family's story. Spielberg has expressed interest in continuing to explore the characters and themes of the film in future projects.

article:
Barry Humphries
================

Barry Humphries is an Australian comedian, actor, and satirist, best known for his character creations, including Dame Edna Everage, Sir Les Patterson, and Sandy Stone. With a career spanning over six decades, Humphries has become a household name in Australia and the United Kingdom, and has gained international recognition for his unique brand of humor and satire.

Early life
-----------

Humphries was born on February 17, 1934, in Melbourne, Australia, to Eric Humphries, a construction manager, and Louisa Alice Wigham. He was the second of three children, and his family lived in the suburb of Camberwell. Humphries developed an interest in the performing arts at an early age, and began performing in school plays and amateur theater productions.

Education
----------

Humphries attended Camberwell Grammar School, where he excelled in English and drama. He later enrolled in the University of Melbourne, where he studied law, philosophy, and English literature. However, he did not complete his degree, instead choosing to pursue a career in the performing arts.

Career
--------

### Early career in Australia

Humphries began his career in the 1950s, performing in various theater productions and revues in Melbourne. He was a member of the Melbourne University Drama Club, and appeared in several productions, including a 1953 production of "The Glass Menagerie". In 1955, he joined the Melbourne Theatre Company, where he appeared in several productions, including "The Importance of Being Earnest" and "The School for Scandal".

### London and the 1960s

In 1959, Humphries moved to London, where he became a key figure in the city's satirical and avant-garde scene. He appeared in several productions, including "Beyond the Fringe", a satirical revue that also featured Peter Cook, Dudley Moore, and Alan Bennett. He also began to develop his character creations, including Dame Edna Everage, who first appeared in a 1956 production of "Wild Life".

### 1970s

The 1970s saw Humphries' career take off, with numerous television appearances and stage productions. He appeared in several episodes of the popular British comedy series "Monty Python's Flying Circus", and created the character of Sir Les Patterson, a lecherous and boorish Australian diplomat. He also began to tour the world with his one-man shows, which featured a mix of comedy, satire, and music.

### Film roles

Humphries has appeared in numerous films, including "The Adventures of Barry McKenzie" (1972), "Barry McKenzie Holds His Own" (1974), and "Shock Treatment" (1981). He has also had roles in several major Hollywood films, including "The Great Beauty" (2013) and "Absolutely Fabulous: The Movie" (2016).

### One-man shows

Humphries has created numerous one-man shows, including "A Night with Dame Edna" (1979), "An Evening with Sir Les Patterson" (1983), and "Eat Pray Laugh!" (2011). His shows often feature a mix of comedy, satire, and music, and have been performed around the world.

### Television roles

Humphries has appeared in numerous television shows, including "The Muppet Show", "The Tonight Show with Johnny Carson", and "Saturday Night Live". He has also created several television series, including "The Dame Edna Experience" (1987) and "Sir Les Patterson and the Aussie Panto" (1991).

### Success in the United States

Humphries achieved significant success in the United States in the 1980s, with numerous television appearances and stage productions. He appeared on "The Tonight Show with Johnny Carson" and "Saturday Night Live", and created the character of Dame Edna Everage's husband, Norman Everage.

### Farewell tour

In 2013, Humphries announced his farewell tour, which featured a mix of comedy, satire, and music. The tour visited numerous cities around the world, including London, New York, and Sydney.

### Weimar Cabaret

In 2016, Humphries created a new show, "Weimar Cabaret", which explored the music and culture of 1920s Berlin. The show featured a mix of music, comedy, and satire, and was performed in several cities around the world.

Characters
-----------

### Dame Edna Everage

Dame Edna Everage is one of Humphries' most famous character creations. She is a Melbourne housewife, who rose to fame as a singer and comedian. Dame Edna is known for her wit, her charm, and her outrageous fashion sense.

### Sir Les Patterson

Sir Les Patterson is another of Humphries' famous character creations. He is a lecherous and boorish Australian diplomat, who has appeared in numerous television shows and stage productions.

### Sandy Stone

Sandy Stone is a character created by Humphries, who appeared in several television shows and stage productions. He is a gentle and melancholic Australian, who sings and plays the guitar.

Personal life
-------------

### Views on transgenderism

Humphries has been criticized for his views on transgenderism, which some have described as transphobic. In 2016, he said that Caitlyn Jenner, the American Olympic athlete, was "a publicity-seeking ratbag".

### Death

Humphries died on April 22, 2023, at the age of 89, after a long illness.

Other work
------------

### Bibliography

Humphries has written several books, including "A Nice Cup of Tea and a Sit Down" (1979) and "Handling Edna: The Unauthorised Biography" (2009).

### Filmography

Humphries has appeared in numerous films, including "The Adventures of Barry McKenzie" (1972), "Barry McKenzie Holds His Own" (1974), and "Shock Treatment" (1981).

### Discography

Humphries has released several albums, including "The Dame Edna Party Album" (1979) and "Les Patterson's Australia" (1983).

### Biographical studies

Several biographical studies have been written about Humphries, including "Barry Humphries: The Biography" (2008) and "Dame Edna: My Life and Times" (2013).

### Fictional characters

Humphries has created numerous fictional characters, including Dame Edna Everage, Sir Les Patterson, and Sandy Stone.

Awards and honours
------------------

Humphries has received numerous awards and honors, including a Tony Award for Best Special Theatrical Event (2000), a BAFTA Award for Best Entertainment Performance (1983), and a Australian Film Institute Award for Best Actor in a Lead Role (1986).

-----

article:
RRR is a 2022 Indian Telugu-language period action drama film written and directed by S. S. Rajamouli. The film is a fictionalized account of the lives of two Indian revolutionaries, Alluri Sitarama Raju and Komaram Bheem, who fought against the British Raj and the Nizam of Hyderabad, respectively. The film features an ensemble cast, including N. T. Rama Rao Jr., Ram Charan, Alia Bhatt, and Olivia Morris.

#Plot

The film is set in the 1920s and follows the story of two Indian revolutionaries, Alluri Sitarama Raju (Ram Charan) and Komaram Bheem (N. T. Rama Rao Jr.), who come from different backgrounds and regions of India. The film explores their lives, struggles, and ultimate friendship as they fight against the British Raj and the Nizam of Hyderabad.

The story begins with the introduction of Alluri Sitarama Raju, a police officer who is tasked with capturing Komaram Bheem, a tribal leader who is leading a rebellion against the Nizam of Hyderabad. However, as Raju delves deeper into the case, he begins to question the morality of his mission and eventually joins forces with Bheem.

The two men form a strong bond and work together to fight against the British and the Nizam, who are exploiting and oppressing the Indian people. Along the way, they encounter various obstacles, including treacherous landscapes, fierce battles, and personal losses.

Throughout the film, Rajamouli uses the story of Raju and Bheem to highlight the struggles of the Indian people during the British Raj and the importance of unity and resistance in the face of oppression.

#Cast

* N. T. Rama Rao Jr. as Komaram Bheem
* Ram Charan as Alluri Sitarama Raju
* Alia Bhatt as Sita
* Olivia Morris as Jennifer
* Ajay Devgn as Venkat Ramanayya
* Shriya Saran as Sarojini
* Ray Stevenson as Governor Scott Buxton
* Alison Doody as Lady Scott Buxton

#Production

##Development

RRR was first announced in March 2018, with S. S. Rajamouli set to direct and produce the film. The film was initially titled "Rise Roar Revolt," but was later changed to RRR. Rajamouli spent several months researching and developing the story, which is based on the lives of Alluri Sitarama Raju and Komaram Bheem.

##Casting

The casting process for RRR began in 2018, with N. T. Rama Rao Jr. and Ram Charan being the first actors to be cast. Alia Bhatt and Olivia Morris were cast later, with Ajay Devgn and Shriya Saran joining the cast in 2019. Ray Stevenson and Alison Doody were cast as the British governor and his wife, respectively.

##Design

The film's production design was handled by Sabu Cyril, who worked closely with Rajamouli to create the film's sets and costumes. The film's cinematography was handled by K. K. Senthil Kumar.

##Principal photography

Principal photography for RRR began in November 2018 and lasted for over two years, with the film being shot in various locations across India, including Hyderabad, Mumbai, and Pune. The film's shoot was delayed several times due to various reasons, including the COVID-19 pandemic.

##Post-production

Post-production for RRR began in 2020, with Rajamouli working closely with his editors and visual effects team to complete the film. The film's visual effects were handled by V. Srinivas Mohan, who worked on several sequences, including the film's action scenes and dramatic moments.

#Themes and influences

RRR is a period action drama that explores several themes, including friendship, unity, and resistance. The film is set in the 1920s and is based on the lives of two Indian revolutionaries, Alluri Sitarama Raju and Komaram Bheem.

Rajamouli has cited several influences for the film, including Indian mythology and history. The film's story and characters are inspired by various Indian folk tales and legends.

#Music

The film's soundtrack was composed by M. M. Keeravani, who worked closely with Rajamouli to create the film's score. The soundtrack features several songs, including "Dosti," "Naatu Naatu," and "Janani."

#Marketing

The marketing campaign for RRR began in 2020, with the film's trailer being released in October 2021. The trailer received a positive response from audiences and critics, with several praising the film's action sequences and dramatic moments.

#Release

##Theatrical

RRR was released theatrically on March 25, 2022, in India and several other countries. The film received a wide release, with several theaters showing the film in multiple languages, including Telugu, Tamil, Hindi, and Malayalam.

##Screenings and statistics

RRR had several special screenings and premieres, including a premiere in Mumbai and a special screening in Hyderabad. The film was also screened at several film festivals, including the Indian Film Festival of Melbourne.

##Distribution

RRR was distributed by DVV Entertainments in India and by several other distributors in other countries. The film was released in several languages, including Telugu, Tamil, Hindi, and Malayalam.

##Home media

RRR was released on home media in May 2022, with the film being made available on several streaming platforms, including Netflix and Amazon Prime Video.

#Critical reception

##India

RRR received widespread critical acclaim in India, with several praising the film's action sequences, dramatic moments, and performances. The film received a 100% approval rating on the Indian review aggregation website Rotten Tomatoes.

##International

RRR also received positive reviews from international critics, with several praising the film's action sequences and dramatic moments. The film received a 90% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes.

#Reception by international filmmakers

RRR was praised by several international filmmakers, including James Cameron and Guillermo del Toro. Cameron praised the film's action sequences and dramatic moments, while del Toro praised the film's visuals and storytelling.

#Box office

RRR was a major commercial success, grossing over ₹1,200 crore at the box office worldwide. The film was the highest-grossing Indian film of 2022 and one of the highest-grossing films of all time.

#Impact

RRR had a significant impact on Indian cinema and culture, with several praising the film's portrayal of Indian history and mythology. The film's success also led to a renewed interest in Indian cinema and culture worldwide.

#Accolades

RRR received several awards and nominations, including several Filmfare Awards and a National Film Award. The film was also nominated for several international awards, including a Golden Globe Award.

#Adaptations

RRR has been adapted into several other forms of media, including a novel and a comic book series. The film's success also led to a renewed interest in the lives of Alluri Sitarama Raju and Komaram Bheem.

#Future

RRR is set to be followed by a sequel, which is currently in development. Rajamouli has announced plans to make a trilogy of films based on the lives of Indian revolutionaries.

* The film's story is based on the lives of Alluri Sitarama Raju and Komaram Bheem, who were two Indian revolutionaries who fought against the British Raj and the Nizam of Hyderabad, respectively.

UAAP Season 85 Volleyball Tournaments

The UAAP Season 85 volleyball tournaments refer to the volleyball events of the University Athletic Association of the Philippines (UAAP) Season 85, held in 2022-2023. The tournaments were divided into four categories: men's, women's, boys', and girls' volleyball. The events were organized by the UAAP, with the participating schools competing in a series of matches to determine the season's champion.

#Tournament format

The tournament format for the UAAP Season 85 volleyball tournaments was a single-round robin elimination, where each team played every other team once. The top four teams in each category then advanced to the semifinals, with the top two teams earning a twice-to-beat advantage. The winners of the semifinals then proceeded to the finals, where the champion was determined.

#Teams

Eight schools participated in the UAAP Season 85 volleyball tournaments: Adamson University, Ateneo de Manila University, De La Salle University, Far Eastern University, National University, University of the East, University of the Philippines, and University of Santo Tomas.

#Squads
